content.description:
Valley Creep climbs a set of nuanced holds and a stressing heel hook on good rock over a good landing.

Sit start with hands matched on the shelf. From there, reach a right hand mini-pinch, follow to a left hand dimple, bump through it to a left hand sloper-pinch, reach a right hand crimp, cross over with the left to a finger-lock, bump the right hand up to an incut sidepull, gain the feet on the start, and finish up the remainder using the edges to gain an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a good landing.
content.location: It climbs the center of Valley Creep's north face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a good edge. From there, make a big move to the positive lip, match, and work a few edges to reach the jug up top for an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate fall zone is great, but there's a nasty rock behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Valley Creep.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand undercling and a right hand edge. From there, gain the hueco and match on it, reach a right hand sidepull, follow to the hueco above it, bump through a sandy left hand block to the lip, throw a heel over, and rock onto the boulder.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing is uneven because a few rocks.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Valley Creep.
